controls.TXT_TranslatedBy: Original HSMAdvisor language by Eldar Gerfanov.
controls.CHK_DefaultForTooltypes: Make default for supported tool types
controls.CHK_DefaultForTooltypes_tooltip: Automatically select this machine when any of the supported tool types are selected
controls.DB_Status_OK: Tool and Machine Database Status: OK
controls.DB_Status_Writing_Error_Text: Failed to write file:{x} With error:{y}
controls.DB_Status_Reading_Error_Text: Failed to read file:{x} With error:{y}
controls.PIC_RPM_Plunge_Lock_tooltip: Lock Plunge RPM to Main RPM
controls.LB_MaxForce_tooltip: Maximum allowed cutting force. Feed rate will be limited to keep the cutting force below this number.
controls.LB_Thread3Wire: Enter known values and hit ENTER
controls.settings_check_swicth_to_warnings: Upon error switch to warnings tab
controls.settings_check_reset_tooldata_upon_toolt: Reset Tool Data (HIGHLY Recommended To Check This One)
controls.LB_Defaults_Text: Here you can set default values for various overrides and limits.
controls.LB_ToolCutDrowdowns_Hint: You can also use Right Mouse Click on Cut and Tool Drop-downs to edit items
controls.EXP_Settings_Things_to_Reset: Fields and Limits that Reset to Default when Tool Type is changed
controls.EXP_Settings_myCUT_DB_Settings: myCut Tool DB and Tool/Cut drop-down list Settings
controls.CHK_Mach_Stick_To_RPM: Calculations stick to predefined RPM from the Power Curve table
controls.CHK_Mach_Stick_To_RPM_tooltip: Check if you want to force calculated RPM to always match predefined RPM from the Power Curve table
controls.LB_Mach_Notice: * RPM Values MUST be in ascending order
controls.BTN_Remove_Mach_tooltip: Remove selected Profile from the list
controls.BTN_Import_Mach_tooltip: Import a Machine Profile from an external file
controls.BTN_Export_Mach_tooltip: Export Machine Profiles to an external file
controls.LB_Max_Tap_RPM_tooltip: Set maximum allowed tapping RPM for your machine
controls.LB_Warning_At_T_tooltip: Generate warning whenever either power or torque are THIS close to the maximum
controls.CHK_Mach_Use_Curve_tooltip: Check if you want to use Power Curve compensation Maximum Power and Maximum Torque Limits will vary according to the spindle RPM
controls.LB_LineRamp_FullSlot_Text: Straight Line Ramping assumes Full Slotting engagement
controls.LB_Circular_Units_Converted_T: All units are converted to the units of the cutter tip diameter
controls.Radio_Ramp_Feed_tooltip: Circular Interpolation and Ramping settings apply to Milling Feedrate
controls.Radio_Ramp_Plunge_tooltip: Circular Interpolation and Ramping settings affect Only Plunging Feedrate
controls.LB_Number_On_Hand_tooltip: Number of tools currently In Stock
controls.LB_Stock_Min_tooltip: Minimum Stock Quantity which triggers a warning
controls.LB_Number_On_Order_tooltip: Number of Tools Currently On Order
controls.LB_SAF_Message: Specify Brand Name and Series Name in Tool Info
controls.BTN_Upload_Machine_tooltip: Upload Current Machine Profile to the Cloud
controls.BTN_Download_Machine_tooltip: Download Machine Profiles from the Cloud
controls.CHK_Private_Machine_tooltip: Uploading this machine as Private does not allow other users to view or download it
controls.LB_Register_About_Cloud: Register for the HSMAdvisor Cloud to upload Machine Profiles, and sync Tools with your other HSMAdvisor instances and FSWizard!
controls.LB_Reset_About_Cloud: You have successfully logged in to your account using a temporary password. As a security measure, we require you to change this temporary password to a new one of your choice. Please provide your new password below.
controls.LB_Remind_About_Cloud: To reset your password and regain access to your account, please provide the email address associated with your account. We will send a temporary password to this email address.
controls.CHK_CutCloudF_Save_Params: Save Feedback Parameters in the Cut
controls.LB_CutCloudAbout: Send feedback about your experience cutting in the current conditions with this tool. Good or Bad - let everybody know how did it go!
controls.MergeToolLibrariesToolStripMenuItem: Merge Tool Library with another one
controls.txt_data_help_label_Body: Use the "Print Current Tab" button on the bottom status bar\nto print the Calculation Report document
controls.LB_Feed_PC_T_Body: ● 30% - Finishing / Very light roughing ● 50% - Semi-finishing / light roughing ● 100% - Normal roughing ● 150% - Heavy roughing: Use caution ● 200% - Very heavy roughing on very rigid setups: Use extreme caution
controls.LB_Max_Feed_T_Head: Maximum Desired Feed rate for your machine
controls.LB_Max_Feed_T_Body: If this limit is reached, Spindle Speed is reduced to match the calculated chip load
controls.PB_Tool_Deflection_Slider_Body: Allows you to limit cutter deflection When end mill deflection exceeds specified percentage, chip load is reduced to prevent cutter breakage ● 70% is the default safe value (You can change it in Settings->Defaults) ● 100% is a maximum safe deflection ● 200% is a maximum survivable deflection Click To Reset to Default
controls.PB_Tool_Torque_Slider_Body: Allows you to limit torque on the cutter by automatically reducing chip load When torque on the end mill exceeds specified percentage, chip load is reduced to prevent cutter breakage ● 70% is the safe value (You can change it in Settings->Defaults) ● 100% is a maximum safe value ● 200% is a maximum survivable torque value Click To Reset to Default
controls.PB_Machine_CuttingForce_Body: Shows the relation between Tool Cutting force and Machine Max Cutting Force set in the Machine Profile
controls.LB_Max_RPM_T_Body: Allows you to limit the spindle speed Feed rate will reduce accordingly but chip load will remain the same
controls.LB_Max_Power_T_Body: Allows you to limit the power that is required to make the cut RPM and Feed rate will be reduced to keep calculated power requirement below this number
controls.LB_Max_Torque_T_Body: Allows you to limit the torque that is required to make the cut Feed rate will be reduced to keep calculated power requirement below this number
controls.LB_WOC_T_Body: Taking small WOC lets you use radial chip thinning that enables higher feed rates CLICK to reset to default
controls.LB_WOC_Threadmill_T_Body: Radial Depth of Thread per each side
controls.LB_DOC_T_Body: Taking small DOC in conjunction with using tools with significant corner radius or low lead angle allows to increase feed rate when Chip Thinning and/or HSM option is enabled. Click to reset to default
controls.LB_DOC_Threadmill_T_Body: Maximum depth of the threading pass
controls.LB_Leadangle_T_Lead_Body: Lead Angle is angle between the cutting edge and a plane perpendicular to the axis the cutter Common values: ● 90 - regular straight edge ● 45 - Common angle for face mills ● 5-30: High feed mills Lower angles allow increased feed rates CLICK to reset to default for this tool type
controls.LB_Leadangle_T_Taper_Body: Angle between the cutting edge and the axis of the cutter CLICK to reset to default for this tool type
controls.LB_Leadangle_T_Tip_Body: Double of the Angle between the cutting edge and the axis of the cutter CLICK to reset to default for this tool type
controls.PNL_MaxPerformance_Body: ● Requires high performance heavy-duty cutters, holders, rigid setup and machine tool. ● Recommended Depth Of Cut is increased ● Recommended Depth Of Cut is NOT reduced to compensate for increased overhang and flute length of an end mill ● Feed rate will be minimally reduced by increased engagement, thus increasing side load on the cutter, deflection and torque ● Deflection and Torque will only be limited by the Tool Safety Limits Make Sure your work holding, tooling and machine tool are up to the job Make Sure your Tool Safety and Machine Limits are setup correctly
controls.PNL_MinPerformance_Body: ● For cases when work holding, tooling or machinery are not sufficiently rigid to use the tool to its full potential ● Advised for unstable cutting conditions ● Recommended Depth Of Cut is reduced to compensate for increased overhang and flute length of an end mill ● When using DOC greater than recommended, Feed rate will be reduced by up to 50% ● Any additional increase in cutter load will reflect in increased deflection Make Sure your Tool Deflection Safety Limit is setup correctly
controls.LB_Depth_T_Body: ● Pecking may be required when drilling deeper holes ● Peck distance recommendation will change according to the depth of the hole ● in cases when depth is less than the length of the tip, Effective diameter will be smaller than the diameter of the drill Click to reset to default
controls.LB_DRL_E_Dia_T_Body: ● Effective diameter of the hole at the specified depth
controls.LB_Speed_PC_T_Body: The program will adjust Cutting Speed according to cutting conditions any overrides you put in place here will add up on top of that ● 30% - Very Heavy roughing and/or very unstable setups ● 50% - Heavy Roughing and/or unstable setups ● 100% - Normal Roughing/Semi-Finishing on stable setups ● 150% - Medium finishing on stable setups ● 200% - Light Finishing on stable setups
controls.LB_TP_Major_Diameter_Body: Major diameter of the thread Required to properly calculate feed reduction to account for difference between tool path and tool radius
controls.LB_DOC_RAD_T_Body: For Turning-Profiling: Radial Depth of Cut For Turning-Grooving: Axial Width of Cut Click to reset to default
controls.LB_Len_T_Body: Distance from tip of the tool to the holder For integrated tooling and arbor-mounted shell mills use distance from spindle nose to the tip of the cutter Click to reset to default
controls.BT_MyCut_Tool_More_Body:
Tool records hold data for all fields except Machine Data and Workpiece Material Add New Tool - A new tool can be added after 'New Tool' is selected from Tool drop-down list Edit Tool Info - Edit Tool manufacturer, vendor and usage information Edit Tool Geometry - Makes tool geometry fields available for edit Delete Tool - Remove selected Tool from the library Save Tool - You can only save changes made to the tool geometry while still in 'Edit Tool Geometry' mode
When a tool is loaded from the DataBase most input fields responsible for tool material and geometry become disabled. In order to enable those fields you need to unload current tool by selecting 'New Tool' from 'Tool' drop-down list
controls.BT_myCut_Cut_More_Body:
Cut records hold data for all fields except Tool Geometry Add New Cut - Add new Cut to the currently selected tool Edit Cut Info - Edit selected Cut information Delete Cut - Remove selected Cut from the library Save Cut - Save changes made to the currently selected Cut
Cut Data contains such information as workpiece material, depth and width of cut, as well as speed, feed and productivity overrides. Each Tool can contain any number of Cuts attached to it
controls.btn_check_Thinning_Body: Check to enable axial and radial chip thinning ● It allows to compensate for chip thinning effect that occurs at low radial and axial engagements ● Usual Width Of Cut for HSM machining is 6-12% or 30-40 degrees ● Running at low engagements improves productivity and tool life ● Enabling Chip Thinning is NOT recommended for finishing as it deteriorates surface finish
controls.btn_Check_HSM_Body: Check to enable High Speed Machining speeds ● It allows to increase cutting speed at low radial engagements ● Usual Width Of Cut for HSM machining is 6-12% or 30-40 degrees ● Running at low engagements improves productivity and tool life ● HSM can be used for both roughing and finishing as it allows to increase cutting speed without sacrificing tool life
controls.Panel_Tool_Manufacturer_Settings_Tip_Bod: ● Here you can adjust the most important parameters to match the manufacturer-recommended settings ● Tool Max RPM is saved both with the Tool and the Cut ● Cutting Speed and Chip load are material-dependent and saved with the Cut ● Click to reset these fields to default
controls.LB_Tool_Max_RPM_Head: Maximum allowed RPM for this tool
controls.LB_Tool_Max_RPM_Body: You can limit maximum allowed RPM for this tool ● Leave this field zero if you wish to use Machine Max RPM setting instead ● Click to reset this field to zero
controls.LB_Ideal_Chipload_T_Body: You can specify manufacturer-recommended or ideal chip load here ● Custom chip load is active only for one particular Cur record and is saved into myCut DB ● Click to reset this field to default
controls.LB_Ideal_Speed_T_Body: You can specify manufacturer-recommended or ideal Cutting Speed here ● Custom Cutting Speed is active only for one particular Cut record and is saved into myCut DB ● Click to reset this field to default
controls.BTN_Reset_all_Body: All fields will be reset to default Current tool will be unloaded Tool geometry and engagement will be set to default for the current cutter type Tool safety limits will be set to default 70% Speed and Feed overrides will be set to 100%
controls.BTN_More_Materials_Body: Launch the material cross reference chart
controls.LB_Chipload_T_Body: Chip load: Advancement of tool per tooth per one revolution Feed per Revolution: Advancement of tool per one revolution ● Expressed in Inches or Millimetres ● Shows recommended Chip load or Feed per Revolution After it gets gets affected by factors like feed override, material load, HSM and Chip Thinning Enter your number and hit Enter to recalculate to this value Click to switch between Chip load and Feed per Revolution display
controls.LB_Speed_T_Body:
Material, Tool and Coating - dependent value. ● Shows recommended Cutting Speed after it gets affected by parameters like: Cutting Speed override, Tool length, material load and HSM _ But before limits like Machine Max RPM Expressed in Surface Meters per Minute or Surface Feet per Minute
Enter your number and hit Enter to recalculate to this value Click to Reset to Default
controls.check_Slotting_Body:
CHECK to force use of full width of the cutter ● Recommended not only when slotting but also when when pocketing
For Ball Nose End Mill: Enables axial tip diameter compensation ● CHECK for end milling and flat floor milling (0-60deg floor) ● UnCHECK for side milling and steep wall milling (60-90 degree wall)
controls.settings_keep_machine_id_Body: Please check if you DO NOT want Machine to change when a cut containing another machine is loaded from the DB
controls.LB_Plunge_T_Body: Theoretical Plunge Rate based on selected Plunging/Ramping parameters ● Use Extreme Caution: Not every tool is designed for plunging or ramping at steep angles - Consult your tool manufacturer ● Safe Ramping angle for most types of solid end mills is 3-5 degrees; for most indexed end mills is 1.5-2 degrees ● Click to reset to Default
controls.chck_Shared_Database_Body: Enable to save your Tool Database in ZIP format for faster read/write operations and 10x smaller file footprint. Recommended for large Data Base files.
controls.BTN_Set_DB_Location_Body: You can specify a custom location for the Tool Data Base By default Tool Database is located in the installation folder in the user_tool_lib.tooldb.xml file ● Using this You can switch between Tool Databases on the fly ● Pointing this location to a network drive will allow more than one instance of HSMAdvisor to access the database at the same time You can start by Exporting your Tool DB to a shared location on a network drive Then you should set the custom location in settings of all HSMAdvisor seats to this file Do not forget to 'Enable Shared Tool Database' option to enable compression and let all HSMAdvisor instances use the same file in real time
controls.BTN_SF_Status_Body: ● Yellow A Automatic Speeds and Feeds produced by internal data tables ● Green M Manufacturer/Custom Speeds and Feeds suggested by [Brand Name]/[Series Name] of the tool for This Material ● Green/Yellow M Partial Manufacturer/Custom Speeds and Feeds suggested by [Brand Name]/[Series] Name of the tool for This Material Group ● You can edit and view chip load tables in Tool Information Dialog Window
controls.btn_Load_Tool_Body: Load Tool/Cut from the Tool Data Base
controls.BTN_FSW_Edit_New_Tool_Body: Unload the Tool, but keep all of its geometry and information data
controls.btn_FSW_Edit_Tool_Body: Edit Tool Usage, Custom Speeds and Feeds, Manufacturer and Ordering information
controls.btn_FSW_Add_Tool_Body: Add this Tool to HSMAdvisor Data Base
controls.btn_Add_Cut_Body: Save these Cutting Parameters into the tool Data Base
controls.CMB_Cut_Body: Use to load a Cut attached to the currently loaded Tool Right Mouse click on drop-down box to choose displayed items and their order Select First Row to unload the current Cut and create a new one
controls.LB_Settings_Lease_Period_T_Body: Use only if you purchased Floating License. Set the amount of time this seat will remain parked on this computer During that time, no other computer will be able to request a seat from the occupied slot. Shorter Parking Period allows to change seats more frequently but requires frequent Internet connections Longer Parking Period allows to reduce the number of Internet connections but does not allow for frequent seat changes Warning: once a seat has been parked, it is impossible to decrease that parking period until the current lease runs out.
controls.PB_Machine_Power_Body: Estimated Spindle Power Required For This Operation Material and MRR-dependent value Expressed in Horse Power or kiloWatts
controls.PB_Tool_Life_Body: Estimated difference in tool life between default and currently used cutting conditions This value shows relative life time of a cutting edge and not amount of material being removed by it
controls.PB_Mrr_Body: A value of machining productivity Expressed in cubic Inches or centimeters of removed material per minute
controls.PB_Tool_Deflection_Head: Estimated Deflection Of The Cutter During Machining Operation
controls.PB_Tool_Deflection_Body: Tool Deflection is dependent on tool stick out, Engagement with material (DOC/WOC) and Material being cut It is recommended to keep tool deflection below 0.001'' or 0.025mm for conventional (No HSM and No Chip Thinning) machining operations Expressed in inches or millimeters
controls.PB_Tool_Torque_Head: Estimated torque percentage from maximum safe value for the given cutter
controls.PB_Tool_Torque_Body: Tool Torque is dependent on Engagement with material (DOC/WOC) and Material being cut Expressed in Percent from a Theoretical Safe Value Theoretical Safe Value of 100% is calculated using safety factor of 2
controls.LB_Feed_T_Body: The relative velocity at which the cutter is advanced along the workpiece Feed Rate is calculated from the Chip Load, Number of Teeth and the Spindle Speed Expressed in inches per minute or millimeters per minute Enter your number and hit Enter to recalculate to this value CLICK to Reset to Default
controls.LB_RPM_T_Body: Speed of rotation of a cutting tool (in case of milling machine) or a workpiece (in case of lathe) Spindle Speed is calculated from the Cutting Speed and the diameter of the cutter or a workpiece Expressed in revolutions per minute Enter your number and hit Enter to recalculate to this value CLICK to Reset to Default
controls.LB_Flute_Len_T_Body: Length of the cutting portion of the tool Cutting Tools are weakest in their fluted portion Choose Tools with shortest possible flute length to minimize deflection and chatter CLICK to Reset to Default
controls.LB_Insert_Len_T_Head: Insert Length of the Turning Tool
controls.LB_Insert_Len_T_Body: Length of the cutting portion of the tool Click to Reset to Default
controls.LB_Helix_T_Body: Angle between the flute and center axis of the tool Higher helical angle reduces vibrations and chatter. It also improves surface finish and increases depth of cut and material removal rates Click to Reset to Default
controls.LB_Shank_Dia_T_Body: Diameter of the portion of the tool that fits into the tool holder Larger Shank Diameter makes the tool more rigid. It increases depth of cut Select tools with increased shank dia in long-reach applications Click to Reset to Default
controls.LB_HolderSize_T_Head: Size of the Turning Tool Body
controls.LB_HolderSize_T_Body: Larger Holder size allows to use deeper depths of cut and higher feed rates Click to Reset to Default
controls.LB_N_Flutes_T_Body: Effective Number of overlapping Flutes, Teeth or Inserts Tools with staggered cutting teeth or inserts have half of effective cutting edges than they appear to have
controls.LB_N_Starts_T_Head: Number of Starts on the tap
controls.LB_N_Inserts_T_Body: Some tools may have more than one cutting edge removing material at the same time Default number is One
controls.LB_Tip_Dia_T_Body: The tip diameter of the cutter
controls.LB_Tool_Dia_T_Body: The nominal diameter of the tool
controls.PB_Machine_Torque_Body: Estimated Spindle Torque Required For This Operation A value dependent on multitude of factors such as material, feed rate and cutter engagement. Expressed in Foot-Pounds or N-M
controls.LB_RPM_Plunge_T_Body: Recommended RPM to use for plunging into the material
controls.LB_DRL_Peck_T_Body: ● Recommended Pecking distance for the current tool type and size of the hole Click to reset to Default
controls.LB_Turn_Dia_T_Body: The diameter of the workpiece after the operation Rough diameter is used to calculate RPM for Profiling Turning Tools Rough_Diameter = Finished_Turn_Diameter + DOC x 2
controls.btn_HSMA_Cloud_Login_Body: HSMAdvisor Cloud Service allows you to access various kind of data stored Online for and by HSMAdvisor Users ● Upload and Download HSMAdvisor Machine Profiles
controls.LB_CutCloudRating_Body: Click to Rate this Cut and submit it to cloud.\nContribute your real-world experience and help this wonderful product become even better!
controls.LB_CloudCutsIndicator_Body: Click to access cuts stored in the Cloud\nA Place where real-world cutting data lives!
controls.PIC_Cloud_Body:
Tools in this Tool Library are synced with HSMAdvisor Cut Cloud.
Go to Actions->Tool Library->Sync with HSMAdvisor Cut Cloud check box to enable or disable synchronization.
Changes (deletes, updates) to tools in this library propagate to all devices.
If you want to keep a Tool offline, simply move it to a library that is not synchronized with the Cut Cloud.
controls.PIC_Cloud_Body_NotLogged: This Tool Library is synced with the Cloud, but you are currently not logged in.\nPlease click on the Cloud icon in the tool bar area to log in.
controls.PIC_Cloud_Toolbar_Body: You are currently logged in to the Cloud.\nThis allows you to upload Machine Profiles and sync your Tool Libraries with the Cloud!
controls.PIC_Cloud_Toolbar_Body_BadToken: Your HSMAdvisor Cut Cloud session has expired, please log in again!
controls.PIC_Cloud_Toolbar_Body_NotLogged: You are currently not logged in to the Cloud.\nNo Machine Profile uploading or Tool Library syncing is possible until you do.\nPlease click on the cloud icon to log in.
controls.LB_License_Description: Thank you for trying out HSMAdvisor Below you can see a counter with number of days remaining in your trial period. Please click Purchase/Enter Key button to purchase your license key or contact us at support@zero-divide.net for assistance.
controls.ERR_MaxRPM: Resulting RPM was limited by Max RPM set in your machine limits
controls.ERR_MaxTapRPM: Resulting RPM was limited by Maximum Tapping RPM set in your machine limits
controls.ERR_Tap_Max_ToolRPM: Resulting RPM was limited by Max Tapping RPM set in your machine limits
controls.ERR_Tap_ToolTorqueLimit: Tool Torque Safety Limit was exceeded
controls.ERR_Tap_PowerCurve_Power_Remedy: Adjust Cutting Speed or Use bigger pilot hole
controls.ERR_Tap_Max_Torque: Machine Max Torque was exceeded. No action was performed
controls.ERR_Machine_Max_Feedrate: The Resulting Feed Rate was limited by Machine Max Feed Rate: {1}
controls.ERR_Machine_Max_Feedrate_Remedy: Consider reduсing cutting speed to avoid rubbing
controls.ERR_Machine_Max_Tap_RPM: Resulting RPM was limited by the Max Tap RPM setting in your Machine Profile
controls.ERR_Tool_MaxRPM: Resulting RPM was limited by Max RPM set in your Tool Manufacturer's settings
controls.ERR_Tap_MinRPM: Resulting RPM is below minimum set in your machine limits, RPM was adjusted to match Min RPM
controls.ERR_Tap_MinRPM_Remedy: Use carbide and/or coated tools to handle higher cutting speeds
controls.ERR_Tool_Length_PRM_Reduced: Resulting RPM was reduced because of the length of the tool
controls.ERR_ThreadMill_MD_TooSmall: Thread Major Diameter is too small
controls.ERR_Tool_Deflection_Limit: Tool Deflection Safety Limit was exceeded, Feed rate was reduced to prevent Cutter breakage
controls.ERR_Tool_Deflection_Limit_Remedy: Reduce cutter engagement with the workpiece
controls.ERR_Tool_Torque_Limit: Tool Torque Safety Limit was exceeded, Feed rate was reduced
controls.ERR_Tool_Torque_Limit_Remedy: Reduce cutter engagement with the workpiece
controls.ERR_DRL_Torque_Limit: Tool Torque Safety Limit was exceeded, Feed rate was reduced
controls.ERR_Machine_PowerCurve_Limit: Machine Power Curve was exceeded, Feed rate was reduced
controls.ERR_Machine_PowerCurve_Limit_Remedy: Adjust cutting speed or reduce cutter engagement with the workpiece
controls.ERR_Machine_Power_Limit: Machine Power was exceeded, Feed rate was reduced
controls.ERR_Machine_Power_Limit_Remedy: Reduce cutter engagement with the workpiece
controls.ERR_Machine_Torque_Limit: Machine Max Torque was exceeded, Feed rate was reduced
controls.ERR_Machine_Torque_Limit_Remedy: Reduce cutter engagement with the workpiece
controls.ERR_Machine_MinRPM_Limit: Resulting RPM is below minimum set in your machine limits, RPM was adjusted to match Min RPM
controls.ERR_Machine_MinRPM_Limit_Remedy: Use carbide and/or coated tools to handle higher cutting speeds
controls.ERR_Machine_Max_Force_Limit: Machine Max Cutting Force was exceeded, Feed rate was reduced
controls.ERR_Machine_Max_Force_Limit_Remedy: Reduce cutter engagement with the workpiece
controls.ERR_PasswordsNoMatch: The two entered passwords do not match
controls.LNG_TextTooLong: Text is too Long: {1} characters max
controls.LNG_ToolSyncedWithCloud: Tool '{1}' synced with the Cut Cloud
controls.LNG_TXT_License_Help_BOX_Trial_Active:
This is a 30 Day trial version of {pname}

This Trial has no functional limitations and works just as any unlimited fully-licensed version.

After Your Trial expires...

You will be limited to just one work-piece material.

All other functionality continues working:

  • Geometry Calculators and Reference Tabs
  • Tool Database Tab
  • Threads Reference Tap
  • Speeds and Feeds Tab with one available material.

Please Purchase a License to Unlock all features!

If you are connected to the Internet simply...

Click on Purchase License link now.

Then in the new window select your Licensing option and proceed to checkout.
Payment processing is automatic and immediate. You will be back up and running in no time!

We have many License options that will fit a shop of any size.

If this computer is NOT connected to the Internet then...

Write down your Computer ID key on a piece of paper.
Then to go to https://hsmadvisor.com/buy/ enter your credentials and proceed to checkout.

Please note that ...

Floating License requires Internet connection at least every 30 days but you can use it on any number of Your computers.

Permanent License can run completely off-line but is locked to this particular computer by its "Computer ID".
In order for you to get correct License Key, you need to install {pname} on the computer you are buying the License Key for.

After payment is processed you will receive email with your License Key and License Information.

Also...

If You have already purchased your license and want to Register this computer, please use Register Automatically link.

You can also register your computers using your web browser. For that please click View My License On-line link.

In case of any difficulties please let us know via email: support@zero-divide.net

Please read here for various Licensing options: HSMAdvisor Licensing Options
controls.LNG_TXT_License_Help_BOX_Trial_Expired:
Your 30 Day trial has expired

Until you purchase a License you are limited to only one Material Type.

If you are connected to the Internet simply...

Click on Purchase License link now.

Then in the new window select your Licensing option and proceed to checkout.
Payment processing is automatic and immediate. You will be back up and running in no time!

If this computer is NOT connected to the Internet then...

Write down your Computer ID key on a piece of paper.
Then to go to https://hsmadvisor.com/buy/ enter your credentials and proceed to checkout.

Please note that ...

Floating License requires Internet connection at least every 30 days but you can use it on any number of Your computers.

Permanent License can run completely off-line but is locked to this particular computer by its "Computer ID".
In order for you to get correct License Key, you need to install {pname} on the computer you are buying the License Key for.

After payment is processed you will receive email with your License Key and License Information.

Also...

If You have already purchased your license and want to Register this computer, please use Register Automatically link.

You can also register your computers using your web browser. For that please click View My License On-line link.

In case of any difficulties please let us know via email: support@zero-divide.net

Please read here for various Licensing options: HSMAdvisor Licensing Options
controls.LNG_TXT_License_Help_BOX_Floating_Active:
You have an active Floating License

This license type allows you to use a single seat of {pname} on multiple computers.

Some information about Your Floating License...

First Name: {U_First_Name}
Last Name: {U_Last_Name}
Email: Hidden

Your Floating License Subscription expires on: {Licence_FloatingExpiresOn} ({Licence_FloatingTimeToExpire} left)
The Floating Seat is parked on this computer for another: {Licence_FloatingParkedFor}

Your License has {Licence_UsedKeys} of {Licence_MaxKeys} seats currently parked.

Did you know that...

Floating License Parking Period in Settings page controls how often {pname} needs to connect to the Internet and for how long a seat remains parked on this computer and thus can not be used on another computer.

Default Floating License Parking Period is just 10 minutes. This means that a single-seat License can be used on a different computer every 10 minutes. License Parking Period can be increased up to 30 days. But in this case you will only be able to move your seat once a month.

If you accidentally set longer parking period than needed and become locked out from using it on another PC let us know via email: support@zero-divide.net and we will fix it for you.

If you plan to use {pname} on multiple computers at the same time please contact us about buying additional seats. There is a considerable multiple-seat discount available

Also...

If You want to use {pname} on another computer simply install it there. Then In the License Activation window enter your First Name, Last Name and the E-Mail address. Click Register Automatically link.

You can also view your License Information on-line. For that please click View My License On-line link.

In case of any difficulties please let us know via email: support@zero-divide.net

Please read here for various Licensing options: HSMAdvisor Licensing Options
controls.LNG_TXT_License_Help_BOX_Full_Active:
You have a Permanent License

This license type never expires and does not require Internet connection.

Some information about Your Permanent License...

First Name: {U_First_Name}
Last Name: {U_Last_Name}
License Key: {U_Serial}

Did you know that...

Permanent License does not rely on Internet connection.
Instead it uses this computer's unique Computer ID key to generate a License Key. Each one of your computers has different Computer ID key and thus will need a unique License Key.

If you plan to use {pname} on other computers please contact us about buying additional seats. There is a considerable multiple-seat discount available

Also...

If You want to transfer your Permanent License to another computer then simply click Log Out link. This will remove your license from the current computer.
Then install {pname} on your new computer and let us know via email that you would like to transfer your License. (Send us your old Computer ID as well)

We will clear things on our side and you will be able to register a new computer in one of the following ways:

  • Launch License Activation window and enter your First Name, Last Name and click Register Automatically link.
  • You can also register your new computer online. For that please click View My License On-line link.
  • Alternatively you can just email us your new Computer ID and we will send you the new License Key.

In case of any difficulties please let us know via email: support@zero-divide.net
Please read here for various Licensing options: HSMAdvisor Licensing Options
controls.LNG_TXT_License_Help_BOX_Floating_Expire:

{pname} will function in limited mode until you Renew Your Subscription

Last Name: {U_Last_Name}
Email: Hidden

Also...

skv_fswizard_tool_type.name: HP/Roughing End Mill
skv_fswizard_tool_type.usage: High Performance/Roughing Endmill requires rigid setup and machine Make sure your clamping and tool holding are adequate

skv_fswizard_tool_type.name: Indexed Drill
skv_fswizard_tool_type.usage: Assumed 1 effective flute (2 staggered inserts)\nCoolant-Through is highly recommended

skv_fswizard_tool_type.name: Spot Drill
skv_fswizard_tool_type.usage: Spotting drills are used to start and locate holes. They create a shallow hole that helps prevent drill bits from deviating from center, when starting to drill.
